Other Information.Additional Info: CO2 adsorption shows tunable microporosity depending on the linker composition.
Transport diffusivity of n-butane is tunable over 6–7 orders of magnitude depending on framework composition.
Transport diffusivity of i-butane is tunable over 4–5 orders of magnitude depending on framework composition.
Water uptake behavior is tunable; materials with high ZIF-7 content are hydrophobic, while those with higher OHC-IM content show increased hydrophilicity.

Sieving Mechanism: Tunable pore size and gate-opening effect via mixed-linker synthesis

Experimental Validation.Method: N2 and CO2 physisorption, water adsorption isotherms, volumetric uptake measurements for n-butane and i-butane diffusion
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: N2 surface area: up to 1200 m²/g; CO2 uptake: varies with composition; n-butane/i-butane selectivity tunable over 4 orders of magnitude

Other Information.Additional Info: ZIF-7-90 materials exhibit multiple crystalline phases (e.g., ZIF-7-II, ZIF-7-90-IV, ZIF-90) with tunable porosity, hydrophobicity, and thermal stability.
